section.heading: Authority to refuse to perform notarial act.

para.text: A notarial officer may refuse to perform a notarial act if the officer is not satisfied that:
The individual executing the record is competent or has the capacity to execute the record; or
The individual's signature is knowingly and voluntarily made.
A notarial officer may refuse to perform a notarial act unless refusal is prohibited by a law other than this chapter.
